info.name: Calculated Metric Services
info.description: A collection of RESTfulAPIs to provide access to Adobe Analytics Calculated Metrics. You can change this description in localconfig.properties

item.name: Retrieves a single calculated metric by ID. Always gives definition in response.

query.description: Locale
Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

variable.description: (Required) The metricId to retrieve

request.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items:
id,name,description,rsid,owner

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
modified: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Calculated metric definition as JSON object

response.name: successful operation

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

variable.description: (Required) The metricId to retrieve

response.name: Unexpected error; calculated metric retrieval failed

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

variable.description: (Required) The metricId to retrieve

item.name: Make changes or updates to an existing metric

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Create metric if not found
Lookup metric by legacyId
Locale

variable.description: (Required) Calculated Metric ID to be updated

request.description:
The following fields can be modified through this endpoint:
name, description, definition, owner, rsidExample "defintion" for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{},"version":[1,0,0]}

Response will be the newly modified calculated metric object after the update request completes.

CalculatedMetricResponse
A metric response will always include these default items:
id, name, description, rsid, owner
Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field as defined/documented in the GET endpoints (see GET "/calculatedmetrics" or GET "/calculatedmetrics/{id}" for more documentation).

response.name: successful operation

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/1.0/analytics/services/calculatedmetrics?expansion=internal,categories&includeType=all,templates&rsids=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&dataType=oberon&ownerId=76002561&calculatedMetricFilter=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&compatibilityRsid=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&toBeUsedInRsid=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&locale=en_US&name=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&dataGroup=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&curatedRsid=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&filterByModifiedAfter=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&includeDeleted=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&limit=10&page=0&sortDirection=ASC&sortProperty=id

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Include additional calculated metrics not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"
Filter list to only include calculated metrics tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)
Filter list to only include calculated metrics compatible with the specified product
Filter list to only include calculated metrics owned by the specified loginId
Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs)

Use this report suite to calculate compatibility if compatibility expansion is specified.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and compatibilityRsid is not then the comaptibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.
The report suite where the calculated metric intended to be used.  This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.
Locale
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains the Name
Filter list to only include calculated metrics with the given dataGroup
Add curatedItem and alternateVariableNames based on the Rsid
Filter list to only include calculated metrics modified since this date (ISO8601 format)
DEPRECATED use deleted includeType - include disabled calculated metrics in results
Number of results per page
Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")
Sort direction (ASC or DESC
Property to sort by (name, modified_date, id is currently allowed)

request.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items:
id,name,description,rsid,owner

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
modified: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Calculated metric definition as JSON object

response.name: successful operation

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Locale

request.description:
Creates a new calculated metric. The following attributes are available when creating a calculated metric:
Required: name, definition, rsid
Optional: descriptionExample definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{},"version":[1,0,0]}

CalculatedMetricResponse
A metric response will always include these default items:
id, name, description, rsid, owner
Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field as defined/documented in the GET endpoints (see GET "/calculatedmetrics" or GET "/calculatedmetrics/{id}" for more documentation).

response.name: successful operation

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Invalid input; name, rsid, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

{
  "filterByModifiedAfter": "1988-12-09T14:10:30.060Z",
  "filteredIds": [
    "et Duis reprehenderit ",
    "aliqua reprehenderit eu minim"
  ],
  "includeTypes": {
    "allIncludeTypesAsList": [
      "des",
      "consec"
    ],
    "allIncludeTypes": [
      "velit",
      "pariatur esse"
    ],
    "empty": true
  },
  "curatedRsid": "ut",
  "ownerId": "dolor Excepteur Lorem elit",
  "rsIds": [
    "ut Lorem eiusmod voluptate",
    "voluptate enim laborum quis"
  ],
  "dataIds": [
    "exercitation non ",
    "tempor"
  ],
  "dataType": "aliquip sed cupidatat labore Lorem",
  "name": [
    "nulla incididunt nisi anim proident",
    "adipisicing ipsum qui"
  ],
  "tagNames": "est",
  "favorite": false,
  "approved": true,
  "curatedIds": [
    "labore ut",
    "tempor irure nostrud elit aliquip"
  ],
  "sharedCalculatedMetricIds": [
    "velit non cupidatat minim",
    "officia in adipisicing"
  ],
  "favoriteCalculatedMetricIds": [
    "minim do ut",
    "consectetur cillum reprehenderit veniam"
  ],
  "approvedCalculatedMetricIds": [
    "amet anim id",
    "velit aute"
  ],
  "toBeUsedInRsid": "do",
  "dataGroup": "cupidatat ut mollit exercitation"
}

item.name: Retrieve a single calculated metric by id

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Whether to include variables that are hidden in the UI or that the user doesn't have permission to.

The report suite where the calculated metric is intended to be used. This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.
Locale

variable.description: (Required) The calculated metric ID to retrieve

request.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner, polarity, precision, type* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric

For more information about calculated metrics go [here](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/analytics-2.0-apis/blob/master/calculatedmetrics.md)

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/1.0/analytics/users/calculatedmetrics?expansion=usageSummary,authorization&includeType=all,templates&rsids=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&dataType=oberon&ownerId=76002561&calculatedMetricFilter=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&filterByIds=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&toBeUsedInRsid=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&locale=en_US&name=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&dataGroup=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&tagNames=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&favorite=true&approved=true&pagination=true&filterByModifiedAfter=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&includeDeleted=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&curatedRsid=mollit tempor Excepteur esse commodo&limit=10&page=0&sortDirection=ASC&sortProperty=id

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Include additional calculated metrics not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"
Filter list to only include calculated metrics tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)
Filter list to only include calculated metrics compatible with the specified product
Filter list to only include calculated metrics owned by the specified loginId
Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs)
Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs) (this is the same as calculatedMetricFilter, and is overwritten by calculatedMetricFilter

The report suite where the calculated metric intended to be used.  This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.
Locale
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains the Name
Filter list to only include calculated metrics with the given dataGroup
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains one of the tags
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are favorites
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are approved
return paginated results
Filter list to only include calculated metrics modified since this date (ISO8601 format)
DEPRECATED use deleted includeType - include disabled calculated metrics in results
Add curatedItem and alternateVariableNames based on the Rsid
Number of results per page
Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")
Sort direction (ASC or DESC)
Property to sort by (name, modified_date, id is currently allowed)

request.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner, polarity, precision, type* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric

For more information about calculated metrics go [here](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/analytics-2.0-apis/blob/master/calculatedmetrics.md)

response.name: successful operation

request.description:
Creates a new calculated metric. The following attributes are available when creating a calculated metric:
Required: name, definition, rsid
Optional: descriptionExample definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{},"version":[1,0,0]}

CalculatedMetricResponse
A metric response will always include these default items:
id, name, description, dataId, owner
Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field as defined/documented in the GET endpoints (see GET "/calculatedmetrics" or GET "/calculatedmetrics/{id}" for more documentation).

response.name: successful operation

      "est ipsum"

  },

  "ownerId": "cupidatat in velit sunt",

    "ea ",
    "adipisicing aliqua occaec"

}

item.name: Retrieve a single calculated metric by id

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Whether to include variables that are hidden in the UI or that the user doesn't have permission to.

The report suite where the calculated metric is intended to be used. This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.
Locale

variable.description: (Required) The calculated metric ID to retrieve

request.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner, polarity, precision, type* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric

For more information about calculated metrics go [here](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/analytics-2.0-apis/blob/master/calculatedmetrics.md)

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.
Include additional calculated metrics not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"
Filter list to only include calculated metrics tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)
Filter list to only include calculated metrics owned by the specified loginId
Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs) (this is the same as calculatedMetricFilter, and is overwritten by calculatedMetricFilter

The data view where the calculated metric intended to be used.  This data view will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.
Locale
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are favorites
Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are approved
return paginated results

Sort direction (ASC or DESC)

request.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner, polarity, precision, type* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric

For more information about calculated metrics go [here](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/analytics-2.0-apis/blob/master/calculatedmetrics.md)

item.name: Returns health status of a service

query.description: (Required) Full health check required : True or False
Includes check for existence of load balancer file as part of the health check.

request.description:
This health check supports two type of operations :

* Partial health check - Simple check if a service if reachable . Set full to false

* Full health check - Checks multiple defined services and returns multiple responses related to those services . Set full to true

response.name: Service is up and running
Service check has encountered one or more errors
